mem_679_minesweeper_jo_2.game module¶

class mem_679_minesweeper_jo_2.game.Board(width, height, num_mines)[source]¶

Bases: object

Represents the Minesweeper game board, which is a grid of Cell objects.

width¶

The number of cells horizontally.

Type:

int

height¶

The number of cells vertically.

Type:

int

num_mines¶

The total number of mines on the board.

Type:

int

grid¶

A 2D list representing the board, containing Cell objects.

Type:

list

check_win()[source]¶

Checks if the player has won the game by flagging all mines and revealing all non-mine cells.

Returns:

True if the player has won, False otherwise.

Return type:

bool

reveal_cell(x, y)[source]¶

Reveals a specific cell on the board.

Parameters:

  • x (int) – The X-coordinate of the cell.

  • y (int) – The Y-coordinate of the cell.

toggle_flag(x, y)[source]¶

Toggles the flag status of a specific cell.

Parameters:

  • x (int) – The X-coordinate of the cell.

  • y (int) – The Y-coordinate of the cell.

class mem_679_minesweeper_jo_2.game.Cell(x, y)[source]¶

Bases: object

Represents a single cell on the Minesweeper board.

x¶

The X-coordinate of the cell.

Type:

int

y¶

The Y-coordinate of the cell.

Type:

int

is_mine¶

Whether the cell contains a mine.

Type:

bool

is_revealed¶

Whether the cell has been revealed.

Type:

bool

is_flagged¶

Whether the cell has been flagged by the player.

Type:

bool

adjacent_mines¶

The number of mines adjacent to the cell.

Type:

int

reveal()[source]¶

Reveals the cell if it is not flagged.

toggle_flag()[source]¶

Toggles the flag status of the cell. Can only flag cells that are not revealed.

class mem_679_minesweeper_jo_2.game.Game(width=10, height=10, mines=10)[source]¶

Bases: object

Represents the main Minesweeper game, handling input, drawing, and game logic.

width¶

The number of cells horizontally.

Type:

int

height¶

The number of cells vertically.

Type:

int

cell_size¶

The size of each cell in pixels.

Type:

int

mines¶

The total number of mines.

Type:

int

board¶

The game board containing all the cells.

Type:

Board

window¶

The Pygame window where the game is drawn.

Type:

Surface

running¶

Whether the game is currently running.

Type:

bool

game_over¶

Whether the game has ended in a loss.

Type:

bool

game_won¶

Whether the game has ended in a win.

Type:

bool

mem_679_minesweeper_jo_2.skeleton module¶

This is a skeleton file that can serve as a starting point for a Python console script. To run this script uncomment the following lines in the [options.entry_points] section in setup.cfg:

console_scripts =
     fibonacci = mem_679_minesweeper_jo_2.skeleton:run

Then run pip install . (or pip install -e . for editable mode) which will install the command fibonacci inside your current environment.

Besides console scripts, the header (i.e. until _logger…) of this file can also be used as template for Python modules.

Note

This file can be renamed depending on your needs or safely removed if not needed.

References

  • https://setuptools.pypa.io/en/latest/userguide/entry_point.html

  • https://pip.pypa.io/en/stable/reference/pip_install

Return type:

mem_679_minesweeper_jo_2.skeleton.main(args)[source]¶

Wrapper allowing fib() to be called with string arguments in a CLI fashion

Instead of returning the value from fib(), it prints the result to the stdout in a nicely formatted message.

Parameters:

args (List[str]) – command line parameters as list of strings (for example ["--verbose", "42"]).

mem_679_minesweeper_jo_2.skeleton.parse_args(args)[source]¶

Parse command line parameters

Parameters:

Returns:

command line parameters namespace

Return type:

argparse.Namespace

mem_679_minesweeper_jo_2.skeleton.run()[source]¶

Calls main() passing the CLI arguments extracted from sys.argv

This function can be used as entry point to create console scripts with setuptools.
